channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bad pothole on a bend, 19th March
item.description:
Bad pothole on a bend makes it very dangerous going round the corner as cars take it wide to avoid . Please fix
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 10 Greenhills Road, Charlton Kings

item.title: Flytipping 48 Henrietta Street, 19th March
item.description:
Several items including damaged car parts, empty cider tins and equipment left on pavement taking up space. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 8 Saint George's Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Verge destroyed by vehicles driving across, 19th March
item.description:
On Gotherington Lane, just before the first unit some of the takeaway traders and delivery drivers are regularly driving over the verge and onto the grassed area. This has totally removed the grass verge, replacing it with mud. As they drive on and off the road mud is being spread over the footpath as well as into the road. Some are also parking part on the footpath and part on the verge. I presume that a notice or talking to the traders and delivery drivers will not result in stopping this as they have been doing it for some time and do not consider it to be unacceptable. Is it possible to have a series of posts in the verge to prevent this from continuing?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 73 Gotherington Lane, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple deep potholes and road deterioration, 19th March
item.description:

item.title: Another clanking drain outside the pub on London Road, 19th March
item.description:
Another drain clanking, right outside The Beaufort Arms ST refused to help for years until the road broke apart chucking chunks of tarmac down the road, with a previous clanking drain (Still not completely fixed, they just rotated the drain cover to make it less likely, now refuse to communicate further.) They deem them to be 'low priority' and even completely cancel complaints. It's all day and night, preventing sleeping and quiet enjoyment of homes. It's not low priority if you have to live with it. Please can you encourage them to resolve the constant noise issues this cause?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 159 London Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Incorrectly synchronised traffic lights, 18th March
item.description:
The left turn signal for leaving the Benhall estate remains red on occasions it could be green. If it made use of these opportunities then it wouldn't need is own sequence therefore improving traffic flow on the A40. This is only occurring since the new lights have been installed with their poorly optimised sequencing
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 55 Whittington Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Incorrectly synchronised traffic lights, 18th March
item.description:
The traffic light on the filter lane to Benhall estate is incorrectly set and is going red everyone the main lights turn red. There is absolutely no need for this, unless the pedestrian crossing is being used. This is only happening since the new lights have been activated.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 55 Whittington Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
